name: Caesar Salad
description: Classic restaurant-quality salad with crispy croutons, parmesan, and creamy dressing.

instructions.instruction: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Remove bread crusts and cut into 2cm cubes.
Spread bread cubes on baking sheet. Drizzle with 2 tbsp olive oil and toss.
Mince 1 garlic clove and sprinkle over bread. Add salt.
Bake 8-10 minutes until golden and crispy. Stir occasionally.
instructions.tip: Croutons harden more as they cool - remove slightly soft.

instructions.instruction: For dressing: Mince remaining 3 garlic cloves very finely or press.
In bowl, combine mayonnaise, mustard, lemon juice, worcestershire sauce, garlic, and optional mashed anchovy.
instructions.tip: Even without anchovy, worcestershire adds slight fish aroma.

instructions.instruction: Slowly whisk in remaining olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.
Wash lettuce leaves and dry. Tear into bite-sized pieces by hand.
instructions.tip: Don't cut with knife - tearing prevents browning.

instructions.instruction: Place lettuce in large salad bowl. Add half the dressing and toss.
Add half the croutons and half the parmesan, toss gently.
Plate, top with remaining croutons, parmesan, and drizzle more dressing.

tips: Croutons can be made a day ahead and stored in airtight container.
For healthier version, use Greek yogurt instead of mayo.
Add grilled chicken for a complete meal.
Shave parmesan with vegetable peeler for elegant look.
storageInfo: Store undressed salad 1 day. Keep dressing and croutons separate.
servingSuggestion: Serve with grilled meat or chicken, or as standalone with garlic bread.
variations: Add grilled chicken or shrimp for protein.
Caesar slaw: Use cabbage - lasts longer.
